text.text: How can I use billing roles and permissions to organize and manage tasks within my billing team?

text: Billing roles and permissions can be used to organize and manage tasks within your billing team. For example, you can give a user the Pre-Biller and the Biller role.

text.text: Where can I assign pre-configured billing roles to user accounts?

text: Pre-configured billing roles can be assigned to user accounts through the Admin > Billing > User Accounts section.

text.text: Can I tailor pre-configured billing roles to fit my agency's specific requirements?

text: Yes, you can tailor pre-configured billing roles to fit your agency's specific requirements.

text.text: What options do I have if I don't want to apply user roles in my agency?

text: If you don't want to apply user roles in your agency, you can either leave the user permissions as they are, remove unneeded permissions, or create your own roles.

text.text: How can I remove existing permissions before applying a pre-configured billing role to a user?

text: If you are planning on applying a pre-configured Billing role to an existing user, it is important to remove all their permissions first. When you apply a role, any existing permissions will be retained on top of the new permissions activated by the role. You may end up with permissions that you do not want so it is a good idea to start with a clean slate.

text.text: Where can I find the pre-configured billing roles in ZOLL Billing Admin interface?

text: The pre-configured billing roles are located in two areas under Admin > Billing: User Accounts and User Groups. You can also create your own groups.

text.text: What actions can Company Administrators perform regarding billing roles and permissions?

text: Company Administrators have full access to everything within ZOLL Billing. They can manage payers and facilities (create, edit, delete, copy) at the parent company level. They can also activate MFA.

text.text: How can I customize pre-configured billing roles to better suit my company's needs?

text: You can customize pre-configured billing roles by adding or removing permissions. You can do this for the role as a whole or for an individual with a pre-configured role. You can also create your own roles and then apply permissions to those roles.

text.text: Can I create custom billing roles based on specific requirements?

text: Yes, you can create custom billing roles based on specific needs.

text.text: What happens if I assign multiple roles to a user in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, you can assign multiple roles to a user. When you apply a role, any existing permissions will be retained on top of the new permissions activated by the role. You may end up with permissions that you do not want so it is a good idea to start with a clean slate.

text.text: How are permissions applied when assigning roles to users in User Groups?

text: Once a role is selected in User Groups, the permissions associated with the role are automatically checked in the "Billing roles & permissions" section. After you click Save, the permissions will be applied to the user the next time they log onto ZOLL Billing.

text.text: What actions are restricted for users with limited billing roles and permissions?

text: Users with limited billing roles and permissions will not be able to perform certain actions in ZOLL Billing. For example, users with the "Billing User" role will not be able to create or edit payers or facilities.

text.text: How do I create custom billing roles in the User Groups section of ZOLL Billing Admin?

text: To create custom billing roles, you can go to User Groups to view a list of the roles, create your own role, and modify the pre-configured Billing role permissions if needed.

text.text: Where can I view and manage user roles and permissions?

text: You can view and manage user roles and permissions in the User Groups section of ZOLL Billing Admin.

text.text: What steps do I take to apply a custom billing role to a user account?

text: To apply a custom billing role to a user account, you can go to Admin > Billing > User Accounts, click on the name of the account you want to add the User Group to, and select the User Group you have recently created.

text.text: Can I modify permissions for individual users within a user group?

text: Yes, you can modify permissions for individual users within a user group. However, these permissions are grayed out and cannot be modified from the user account page. To make changes to the permissions, you need to navigate back to the User Groups section.

text.text: How do dependencies affect the assignment of permissions in billing roles?

text: Dependencies are permissions that need other permissions to work. For example, a user cannot "Edit claim header" without access to the "View completed claim" permission. If there is a dependency, you will see it called out in the pop-up window when you click the permission name.

text.text: What functionalities are available for all users regardless of their permissions?

text: Company Administrators have full access to everything within ZOLL Billing. It does not matter what permissions you give, or not give, to a Company Administrator. This account type overrides any other setting in "Billing roles & permissions". To apply permissions to this user you will need to change their account type to Standard Users.

text.text: How can I access reports to view the roles and permissions assigned to users?

text: You can use the "User and Assigned Groups" and "User and Assigned Permissions" reports to view the roles and permissions assigned to users. These reports can be found under Analytics > Reports. If the permission was inherited via a role, that permission highlights in blue. If the permission was manually assigned, it won't have a highlight.

text.text: What information is provided in the "User and Assigned Groups" report?

text: The User and Assigned Groups report shows a list of users and their assigned roles.

text.text: Where can I find the "User and Assigned Permissions" report ?

text: The "User and Assigned Permissions" report can be found under Analytics > Reports.

text.text: How do I distinguish between permissions inherited via a role and those manually assigned to a user?

text: If the permission was inherited via a role, that permission highlights in blue. If the permission was manually assigned, it won't have a highlight.

text.text: What are the status reasons associated with billing roles?

text: The status reasons associated with billing roles are: Coding needed, Facility needed, Payer needed, Charge needed.

text.text: Where do the new status reasons appear in ZOLL Billing interface?

text: The new statuses will be available for selection when you click the edit pencil next to the status / status reason on the claim header. For example, Suspended - Coding needed.

text.text: Can I view the new status reasons on the Dashboard?

text: Yes, you can view the new status reasons on the Dashboard. When you click Incomplete or Suspended in the list of "Claims by status", one of the new statuses listed above will display if they are assigned to a claim.

text.text: What options are available for status reasons when editing a claim header?

text: When editing a claim header, you can select from the following options for status reasons: Closed, Follow-up, Incomplete, New claim, Queued for submission, Submitted, Suspended

text.text: How do the new status reasons improve claim management?

text: The new status reasons support the Billing roles and permissions. For example, the status reason "Coding needed" allows users to manage claims that require coding.

text.text: Are there any permissions or roles associated with managing tags in Zoll Billing?

text: The creation and management of tags are not tied to any permission or role which means that all users can create / manage tags.

text.text: What functionalities are accessible to Company Administrators?

text: Company Administrators can manage payers and facilities (create/edit/delete/copy) at the parent company level. They are the only account types that can perform these types of actions regardless of permissions given to specific roles. This reduces the chances of duplicates in the system.

text.text: How can I ensure that the permissions and roles I assign align with my agency's operational requirements in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can assign pre-configured roles to users, customize pre-configured roles, or create your own roles. You can also remove unneeded permissions. When you apply a role, any existing permissions will be retained on top of the new permissions activated by the role.
